name: Herman PETROFF and Henrietta Petroff, individually and as husband and wife, Appellants, v. REDEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY OF the CITY OF PHILADELPHIA and Seventh and Chestnut Associates and Norman Wolgin and Waverly Management
name_abbreviation: Petroff v. Redevelopment Authority of Philadelphia

judges: Before LARSEN, FLAHERTY, ZAPPALA, PAPADAKOS, CAPPY and MONTEMURO, JJ.
NIX, C.J., did not participate in the consideration or decision of this case.
parties: Herman PETROFF and Henrietta Petroff, individually and as husband and wife, Appellants, v. REDEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY OF the CITY OF PHILADELPHIA and Seventh and Chestnut Associates and Norman Wolgin and Waverly Management.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
Appeal dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
NIX, C.J., did not participate in the consideration or decision of this case.
MONTEMURO, J., dissents.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: John L. More, Philadelphia, for Seventh & Chestnut Assoc, and Waverly Management.
Lawrence R. Diamond, Philadelphia, for Redevelopment Authority of the City of Philadelphia.
casebody.head_matter:
618 A.2d 391
Herman PETROFF and Henrietta Petroff, individually and as husband and wife, Appellants, v. REDEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY OF the CITY OF PHILADELPHIA and Seventh and Chestnut Associates and Norman Wolgin and Waverly Management.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Dec. 8, 1992.
Decided Jan. 7, 1993.
Ned Hark, Philadelphia, for appellants.
John L. More, Philadelphia, for Seventh & Chestnut Assoc, and Waverly Management.
Lawrence R. Diamond, Philadelphia, for Redevelopment Authority of the City of Philadelphia.
Before LARSEN, FLAHERTY, ZAPPALA, PAPADAKOS, CAPPY and MONTEMURO, JJ.
